schema:name: Red List Index for England by broad taxonomic group, 2022 baseline

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:name: D5 Conservation status of our native species, 2022 (NERR124)

schema:variableMeasured: red list index ranking of native species
notes:
Results are based on Great Britain Red List assessments of species known to be native to England.

</br>The Red List Index for England includes 8,259 taxa across 23 major taxonomic groups. The 'Aggregate' category summarises the results for all these taxa. Thereafter, taxonomic groups are shown in order of decreasing extinction risk from top to bottom.
    
</br>Comparisons of Red List Index values between groups can be uncertain because of differences in underlying Red List data, including data quality, taxonomic rank, and extinction definitions.

datatype.format: Butterflies|Birds|Amphibians and reptiles|Scarab beetles and allies|Mammals (non-marine)|Dragonflies and damselflies|Freshwater Fish|Bolete fungi|Clown and False-clown beetles|Shield bugs and allies|Longhorn beetles|Carrion beetles|Wood boring beetles and allies|Leaf beetles and allies|Grasshoppers, crickets and allies|Darkling beetles and allies|Mayflies|Soldier beetles and allies|Ground beetles|Soldier flies and allies|Vascular plants|Water beetles|Spiders|Aggregate|Mosses and liverworts|Lichens|Caddisflies|Molluscs (non-marine)|Rove beetles (macrostaphs)|Spear-winged and Flat-footed flies|Long-legged flies|Stoneflies|Pill beetles and allies|Rove beetles (tachyporines)|Water bugs|Millipedes, centipedes and woodlice|Hoverflies

columns.name: Red List Index group
columns.schema:description: Red list group of native species

columns.name: value
columns.schema:description: The red list index ranking of native species
